text: Alan Zweibel (born May 20, 1950) is an American producer and writer. He was one of the original writers on Saturday Night Live.McGee, Celia. "How to Mourn a Friend? One Way Is With a Play", The New York Times, March 9, 1997. Accessed 18 May 2016. "Mr. Zweibel harbored secret ambitions to write as far back as his days as a jock at Hewlett High School on Long Island. After graduation from the University of Buffalo...." He and Garry Shandling were the co- creators of Showtime's It's Garry Shandling's Show. Zweibel was born to a Jewish family in Brooklyn and grew up in suburbs of Wantagh and Woodmere on Long Island. Zweibel graduated from George W. Hewlett High School and the University at Buffalo, The State University of New York. In 2006, Zweibel won the Thurber Prize for American Humor for his book The Other Shulman. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website * Alan Zweibel on Twitter * Alan Zweibel on Facebook * Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:American movie directors Category:American movie producers Category:American television personalities Category:American television producers Category:American television writers Category:Emmy Award winners Category:Writers from Brooklyn
